Articles.Content:
Hi guys!

I found something really cool! Did you know that multiple quick saves was possible in stock KSP? Yes it is!

Keys:

ALT+F5 - Save as...

ALT+F9 - Load quick saves

Proof:

Javascript is disabled. View full album

If you don`t believe it, try it for yourself

Comment highlights from below: (Thanks for Temeter for the tip about the highlights)

Wonder how many people will ALT F4 instead of quicksaving
You can rename stuff from the tracking station by clicking its name in the orange bar at the top of the "i" button's menu thingy. ANY stuff - well okay, not planets ofc, but you can rename asteroids, debris, etc.
Another feature: asteroid samples can be retaken depending on the situation. I just flew a mission where the asteroid went from space high above Kerbin, to the Mun and then a close encounter with the Mun (<15km). I got three surface samples for the mission.
The 'control from here'-function isn't reset by switching to other crew modules. Meaning you can now control ships from a centered-module while sitting high above the ship in a control tower.

Its only reset when switching from docking modules to iva.

Edited April 15, 2014 by greg12
omg wow... I always copy the actual files, this is so much easier
Woah... Okay I'm going to try this
If this works.... My life will be complete lol
That's incredibly useful!! Why did I not know about this? Is it documented? This will be very useful on repeated risky maneuvers
WHAT? Pinch me, this isn't the 1st of April any more right?
Why didn't you tell me this before my mission got screwed up!

Yup, confirmed.

Well spotted!
Is this a new thing, or was it just never spotted before?
Please let this be true
I know there is a mod that adds this functionality, but seeing as ive never used it i dont know how to operate it.

That's incredibly useful!! Why did I not know about this? Is it documented? This will be very useful on repeated risky maneuvers

That is the funny thing about KSP.. no such features have ever been documented.. I have over the last years so many times wished for a feature only to realize later that it was already there just that no one really knew about it until they learned about it by accident.

It would not at all surprise me if this quick save feature was there before 23.5 as well...
Oh my god.
confirmed.
Apparently, this is a debug tool that they have decided to leave available to players. It was a last-minute thing, which is why there was no information about it beforehand.
Oh god. This changes everything.

Apparently, this is a debug tool that they have decided to leave available to players. It was a last-minute thing, which is why there was no information about it beforehand.

Ooooh sweet. I wonder what else was left in for us to find. I've already noticed a lot of "little" bugs have been fixed and have made the game SOOOO much better. Extra features though are always fun to find. Well spotted OP.

lol... nice of the devs to mention it!

This is basically what we've been asking for since like, 0.18...

WAT

Alt+f5 works now?!?

As in, I discovered the Alt+f9 thing in the last version, but Alt+f5 didn't seem to do anything.

I noticed that in the science review section... there is a check mark type thing next to science you've collected and it shows you the message you got when you collected it.

That may have already been there but this is the first time I noticed it.

Damn! Good catch!

EDIT I will see if it is in .23 on the morrow, I still got my modded game left.

Edited April 8, 2014 by KvickFlygarn87

Whoah. Now I just need to REMEMBER this is there. Like ya know, quicksaves anytime- no more "under acceleration" or "in atmosphere" restraints, so, if you have a vessel mysteriously under accel in orbit and need to leave, F5, then space center.

Just found something else by accident... When did the Recover Vessel button appear behind the Altimeter?

When your craft lands and you move the mouse over the altimeter the button appears.

Hmm, afaik that is there since the career mode was introduced. In v. 0.23 to be exact. ;-)

Greets,

Jan
This is like finding a Ã‚Â£20 down the back of the sofa.
